intro: Cyrtandra seganica, commonly known as the Seganica beech. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae, native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural collections.
